conclusion: Visitors can reach the observation deck in about one minute by taking the observation elevator.
The elevator is simplified to only be affected by gravity and the tension of the rope.
The elevator starts to ascend from rest at t=0.
The diagram shows an acceleration-time (a-t) graph with acceleration on the y-axis and time on the x-axis.
From t=0 to t=1s, the acceleration is increasing linearly from 0 to 2 m/s².
From t=1s to t=4s, the acceleration is constant at 2 m/s².
From t=4s to t=5s, the acceleration decreases linearly from 2 m/s² to 0.
From t=5s to t=55s, the acceleration is 0.
From t=55s to t=56s, the acceleration decreases linearly from 0 to -2 m/s².
From t=56s to t=59s, the acceleration is constant at -2 m/s².
From t=59s to t=60s, the acceleration increases linearly from -2 m/s² to 0.

premise: The area under the acceleration-time graph represents the change in velocity.
conclusion: The total area under the graph from t=0 to t=60s is 0.

premise: The total area under the graph from t=0 to t=60s is 0.
conclusion: At t=60s, the elevator's speed is exactly 0.
